Do you see that pile of chrome over there? No? Neither do I. Because the machine was VAPORIZED! Good that you gave me 2 singularities, the first one... Well... Just get me a better casing, would you?

It seems, that the stabilizers need... stabilizing... But I'm out of field generators. Can you help me with this?

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest351.name
questDatabase.description: I've observed your pathway, and I have to say, I'm impressed. I might need your help soon, on a big project of mine.

pages:9:
Conceptual Device:
The Zero-Point-Module.

Hello my friend.
I need you to help me with a pr

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest352.name
questDatabase.description: If I could only use it... Well, hi there my friend. I need your help with a project of mine. I want to create an immense power source, but I have a few problems that I need to solve first. Will you help me? You shall be rewarded.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest353.name
questDatabase.description:
I need to open a wormhole. But for that, I need an immense gravitational field. One like those created upon the death of a star. But I can't really "kill" a sun for this. I need to compress matter somehow... 
But... How?

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest354.name
questDatabase.description: Of course! The matter condenser! How come I didn't think of that?

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest355.name
questDatabase.description: Opening the wormhole is one thing, but I need to stabilize it, so it doesn't harm anything. I guess I need something made of crystal. Why? Because I like it fancy. Find me a crystal-based, transparent material with immense power, would you?

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest356.name
questDatabase.description: What in the world is this? This is amazing! I need more of these! They will be an amazing containment material for the wormhole!

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest357.name
questDatabase.description: What... I work a lot! So get me some food please.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest358.name
questDatabase.description: Given the fact that I will be able to craft this device, it needs some kind of "plug" to get the power out. I need something to conduct immense amounts of power. I thought about superconductors, but they don't fit with the crystal casing material I have in mind. I need 2 different crystals, one for positive and one for negative charge.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest359.name
questDatabase.description: Really? A red and blue crystal? How awesome is that! I think I will need 8 of each color, just to be sure.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest360.name
questDatabase.description: I need something for the outer shell. Again, a crystal-based material, because I like it shiny. I tested all crystals we know, and none of them meet the requirements. I heard you have access to the space? Can you try to find a suitable material while you're out there?

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest361.name
questDatabase.description: Yes. Yes! That's it. Bring me more of this stuff! I probably need a lot of it...

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest362.name
questDatabase.description: What is this? Draconium dust? I wonder if I could use this for something...

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest363.name
questDatabase.description:
Hey my friend. I got your sample, and I have to say, I'm amazed. This material has a lot of potential, but it's useless at the moment. I have an idea how to turn this into something useful, but I need you to help me with a few problems first.

I need a good handful of that stuff for my research. Please get me some.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest364.name
questDatabase.description: First things first, we need a hull. I played around with your sample, and it seems that it reacts with every known material. It even attacks Iridium! It's completely harmless if it's in a box that is open, but as soon as I try to enclose it in something, poof. It breaks free. We need something stronger than iridium my friend.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest365.name
questDatabase.description:
Now look at this. This stuff is incredibly dense. Maybe this material will be sufficient?

This looks promising. Send me some samples, and I will try my luck.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest366.name
questDatabase.description: This place is interesting. Maybe I should try to find new materials here...

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest367.name
questDatabase.description:
Heh, neutronium. I didn't even know such a thing really exists. Unfortunately, the draconium dust was enclosed for... 5 seconds? But, it was a small success. 

Ok let's travel to some planets and moons and look for the new material. I think we have to fly very far away for it.

Lore:9: Formerly known as Neutronium
Formerly known as Neutronium

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest368.name
questDatabase.description:
This doesn't seem to be dense, but it's a material you haven't seen before. Maybe this could be the solution?

Black what? Huh, interesting. Send me some samples, I want to analyse it.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest369.name
questDatabase.description: Surprisingly, this material is able to contain the draconium dust. It could be the radiation. Good job my friend!

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest370.name
questDatabase.description: I've created a first sample of what I shall call "Draconium Dust core". Not quite the result I expected to be honest, but see for yourself.

Lore:9: The first sample. Wait.. Is that... a button?
The first sample. Wait.. Is that... a button?

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest371.name
questDatabase.description: The problem is, that the immense power of this dust is released all at once. We need something to control the vast amount of energies. I noticed that the dust starts to glow when it gets near an aura node. Maybe Thaumaturgy has the solution?

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest372.name
questDatabase.description: What else could control energies better than a focus of crystallized primal energy? With this little item, it should be possible to control the energies released from the dust.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest373.name
questDatabase.description: You haven't heard anything in a while from the technician. You have a feeling that something might have gone terrible wrong, so you went to his place to investigate. What you found was... nothing. A void. It seems that he tried to combine the pearl with the dust. What did he say? The dust reacts to aura nodes? Of course it does. It amplifies the energies by a thousand times. And giving it raw primal energy, good lord, what has he done. May he rest in peace...

Lore:9: A mix of draconium dust, a primordial pearl
and.. Is that a bone?
A mix of draconium dust, a primordial pearl
and.. Is that a bone?

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest374.name
questDatabase.description: I need to continue my research. I still think that this primordial pearl is the key to control the dust, but I'm not sure how. Maybe the pearl is just too strong? I should try to use something that's similar, but less powerful. It reacts to vis, so maybe.. I should try to make a wand focus with that pearl. That way, I could channel vis into the dust without actually combining both.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest375.name
questDatabase.description: This metal has quite interesting properties. It seems, that it has absorbed some of the energy that exists in the End. While ender pearls are quite fragile, this metal is a lot more durable. However, the absorbed energy is not enough to teleport things around. But you might find a solution for this.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest376.name
questDatabase.description: It's purple, and it smells like rotten eggs. But while staring at this unpleasant fluid, you had an idea. You can't reach the dust directly, but can you actually teleport something in and out the field? Might be worth a try.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest377.name
questDatabase.description: You've tried a lot, and nothing was quite enough to activate the dust. Until now. You finally found a focus that is able to transmit enough power to cause a heavy reaction with the dust, but not enough to cause problems.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest378.name
questDatabase.description: At least for a short period of time. The wand focus is powerful enough to activate the dust, but it will convert back to regular dust as soon as I stop feeding it with vis. If I only could contain it, surround it with a forcefield...

Lore:9: Unfortunately, it has already lost its power

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest379.name
questDatabase.description: In order to create a forcefield, I need to build myself a containment device. I will use only the best emitters I can afford. I will take no risks here.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest380.name
questDatabase.description: The outcome was... interesting. It did not explode, instead, the activated draconium dust generated a counter-field to mine! Unfortunately, the emitters could not stand the reverse energies, and melted. I was able to shut it off quick enough to save the machine casing (At least what's left from it...) And a couple of field generators.

Lore:9: A pile of something that
used to be a machine hull
A pile of something that
used to be a machine hull
A few scratches here and there,
but still usable

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest381.name
questDatabase.description: I came to the following conclusion: Draconium dust seems to react nicely with all kinds of magic energy, and seems to repel technology. So I need to find a way to create a forcefield with magic alone. There must be a way...

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest382.name
questDatabase.description:
While node stabilizers are too weak, you found a way to generate a strong containment field, generated by magic itself. You tried to use warded glass, but even the "frozen in spacetime" material could not resist the power of activated draconium dust. You decided to build another device, this time with your newest invention.

The vortex attenuator is powerful enough to negate even hungry nodes, and it also will be able to contain activated draconium dust.

Just to be sure, I will add some amplifiers to it.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest383.name
questDatabase.description: The device works! It is able to fully contain and separate the draconium dust from everything around it! Unfortunately... It also prevents the vis from passing the barrier, which results in regular draconium dust... In a forcefield...

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest384.name
questDatabase.description:
It is frustrating. Either you are able to contain the dust but can't activate it, or, you activate it and it causes serious damage. Maybe you need to find answers somewhere else.

Draconic... Like... Dragon?

Lore:9: Unfortunately, it has already lost its power

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest385.name
questDatabase.description: Maybe you where looking for the right things in the wrong place. As this dust obviously origins from dragons, the best thing to do now is to find answers in the dimension of dragons: The End.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest386.name
questDatabase.description: These ghosts are weird beings. But, I found this ectoplasm, which, by itself, seems to be pretty useless.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest387.name
questDatabase.description: By a random guess of yours, you combined molten ender pearls and a few more of these shards with an empty gem, and it turned blue. It is pulsating with power. You tried to use it on your containment device, and it seems to be able to bypass the force field, while keeping it intact that the same time. Sadly, it doesn't have enough power to let vis pass through. Maybe you can even further increase the gems power?

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest388.name
questDatabase.description: While the normal world is based on vis and primal energy, the End seems to be quite different. This arcane shard is the crystallized form of this energy, just like the primal shards that you used so many times in the past. By pure randomness, you discovered that it reacts with the metal you've found.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest389.name
questDatabase.description: After a long and tedious path, you finally managed to create a device that is able to activate draconium dust, trap it in spacetime, and make use of the vast energies it emits while activated. The result is a perfectly stabilized core, that is completely harmless by itself, but is also able to provide incredible amounts of power on demand.

Lore:9: Emits a strong, vibrating aura of pure energy you never experienced before.
In good memory of your old friend, the technician. May he rest in peace
Emits a strong, vibrating aura of pure energy you never experienced before.
In good memory of your old friend, the technician. May he rest in peace

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest390.name
questDatabase.description: This new metal is quite cheap, and has an awesome conductivity towards all 6 primal aspects. Regarding the capsule, I'd say it is a superconductor for vis. I think I can finally assemble the final frame.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest391.name
questDatabase.description:
The machine is working pretty well, but it's tedious to fill in the reagents manually. But you have an idea, you could use a few basic components to fully automate the process.

You can use robot arms and conveyor belts to automate the input and output.

Obviously, you need to power the machines. A solar panel will do just fine.

In order to automate the catalyst, you need a few things. One golem will gather basic materials, while the second one will hunt creepers and ghasts for the more valuable ingredients.

You found a way to re-use the singularity, so you only need to get some sand. Luckily, the golem that works on the catalyst will be able to get glass too. He just needs a little additional motivation.

Your golems need light, obviously. Also, it would be nice if there are some signal lamps that indicate the status of the process. Would it not?

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest392.name
questDatabase.description: You are sure that you've just discovered the solution for your containment problem. This gem happily transmits vis on request, while keeping the containment field intact. What a great day!

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest393.name
questDatabase.description:
Now that you are able to contain the activated draconium dust for an infinite amount of time, you where able to assure the energy it releases. The readings are incredible. You have never seen such a power before. The only problem is, the machinery required to keep the dust in this state is too large to use it for crafting.

You noticed something that might help: The dust reacts to vis, but it needs a lot of it, therefore you require the animation focus. If you could find a catalyst, that you can mix the dust with, you could make the dust react with the vis from its surroundings instead of a direct beam.

Lore:9: Unfortunately, it has already lost its power
Unfortunately, it has already lost its power

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest394.name
questDatabase.description:
That's it. This catalyst contains all primal energies in a quite different form, a lot weaker than any node. However, in combination with the draconium dust, it amplifies the vis that's around it, which leads to a permanent activation. It still needs to be contained, but you don't need the direct vis beam any more.

The result is a compound, which still emits massive amounts of power, but is less destructive. It still attacks the neutronium, but I think if I can find a capsule-like container that has special properties, I could create a portable version of it.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest395.name
questDatabase.description:
By combining a dimensional singularity with some glass cylinders and molten gold, I was able to create a miniature containment field within a very small area. Interesting enough, the new draconium blend amplifies the containment field from the inside. Once I fill the blend in the capsule, it immediately "seals" itself. I won't be able to remove or replace the dust any more, but I don't think I have to...


The perfect vessel for massive power!

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest396.name
questDatabase.description: Now that I've found a way to stabilize the draconium dust and keep it safe in a small capsule, I just need to make a small container for it, so I can drain the energy on demand. Neutronium will serve very well, but I need a magic conductor. Thaumium works, but gets way too hot and void metal has a bad conductivity. I need to find a magic alloy that is more "balanced" in terms of primal aspects

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest397.name
questDatabase.description: Using your machine, you can now craft infinite amounts of these cores. And since it would be gruesome to let your golem work just for one single core, you decided to only request cores in a large batch of 16. How nice of you.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest398.name
questDatabase.description: Baba Yaga is a witch (or one of a trio of sisters of the same name), who appears as a deformed and/or ferocious-looking elderly woman. She flies around in a mortar and wields a pestle. She dwells deep in the forest, in a hut usually described as standing on chicken legs, with a fence decorated with human skulls. Baba Yaga may help or hinder those that encounter or seek her out.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest399.name
questDatabase.description: A Horned Huntsman is a member of the Wild Hunt, a powerful entity created by the Horned God. If one is encountered, prepare for a hard fight, or better flee.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest400.name
questDatabase.description: The dragon must die. Long enough he destroyed those precious endstone blocks!

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest401.name
questDatabase.description: Leonard is the demonic being who is rumored to have taught a cadre of German witches their trade, and often presided over their sabbats. A skilled coven with the witches cauldron can summon a Shade of the Demon according to the method described in the Witches' Brews book.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest402.name
questDatabase.description: A Lord of Torment is a mighty demonic being that is able to create prisons to Torment its victims. Those foolish enough to summon one of these creatures must prepare for an arduous fight.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest403.name
questDatabase.description: Mog and Gulg are the god-like beings that Hobgoblins worship. They may send their avatars to pay witches a visit who exploit their worship (with a Statue of Hobgoblin Patron). Rumor has it that using a nether star may make them take immediate notice.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest404.name
questDatabase.description: Demons are powerful, evil beings who dwell in the infernal dimensions. To date, none have been seen roaming the Nether, where their minions: ghasts, blazes and their ilk seem to dominate. To meet a demon without a way to protect oneself is almost certain death. They are known to hit like a proverbial truck, and require a significant amount of damage to kill. Some demons have even been seen shooting fireballs! They are, of course, also immune to fire.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest405.name
questDatabase.description: You've mastered everything possible. And now it's time to give your equipment the final boost. The infinity egg is just the right addition to your altar. It's quite expensive, but worth the cost.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest406.name
questDatabase.description: Well, both are red, so that connection was quite obvious... Was it...?

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest407.name
questDatabase.description: The basic slates. Basically just stone with blood.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest408.name
questDatabase.description: It's quite difficult to see how much blood there is in your altar, or your personal blood network. This little device will solve that problem for you. Just a little prick in the finger, and everything will be revealed.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest409.name
questDatabase.description: The basic rune that you can craft at this moment.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest410.name
questDatabase.description: Not like "BloodAlchemy". You probably will need more than one later, but for now one is sufficient.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest411.name
questDatabase.description: In order to manipulate potions you need catalysts. You then combine the ingredient you used to get the potion effect in with either a lengthening or power catalyst to increase the duration or the level of the potion effect.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest412.name
questDatabase.description: Alchemy can be weird, and tedious. There are a lot of reagents and even more possible combinations. For now, and in order to get started, you need a couple of basic things.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest413.name
questDatabase.description: If empty, you don't have to throw the potion away. Just refill it.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest414.name
questDatabase.description: Regular glass phials are unable to hold these special potions you want. You need to imbue it with some blood from your altar.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest415.name
questDatabase.description: Just to give you an idea what is possible. Let's do a sample potion. Shall we? Get yourself a potion flask, a feather and one of your weak binding agents you made. Combine those in the chemistry set, and you'll get something that you'll probably want to keep for a while.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest416.name
questDatabase.description: The simple spell system is rather easy to setup, and can be done early on in your bloodmagic career.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest417.name
questDatabase.description: Paradigms shape your spell.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest418.name
questDatabase.description: You have nine basic elements and each have a focus, an item that represents them. You place this focus in your altar next to the spell table in order for your magic to flow through it and the paradigm.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest419.name
questDatabase.description: There are a LOT of spell combinations to discover, so just trial and error!

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest420.name
questDatabase.description: Collecting items while mining or chopping wood is always tedious. But no more! With this fancy little thing items will just fly towards you! And it only costs a little bit of blood to pay the spirits of wind to work for you.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest421.name
questDatabase.description: ...and even more blood.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest422.name
questDatabase.description: You need MOOORE. Imbue some slates with even more blood.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest423.name
questDatabase.description: Your Tier 2 orb.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest424.name
questDatabase.description: Your Tier 3 orb.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest425.name
questDatabase.description: Creation of better ritual stones.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest426.name
questDatabase.description: Poking your finger might work for simple slates and runes, but getting enough blood for advanced stuff is tedious. With sacrificial runes you are able to increase the LP gain from mobs or yourself.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest427.name
questDatabase.description: The first rune to increase your capacity, and a rune to speed up transfer from/to external tanks.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest428.name
questDatabase.description: Now that you have access to elemental chalk, you can get yourself the basic ritual diviner. A convenient way to place simple but yet complex rituals.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest429.name
questDatabase.description: A long way to go, and rather expensive, but a really powerful armor and worth the effort.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest430.name
questDatabase.description: Enable your sword by Shift right-clicking and slay some enemies! Collect as many shards as possible. You will need a ton of them...

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest431.name
questDatabase.description: Time to assemble your armor. You need to build the pattern with blocks as you would craft the armor in a crafting table. The soul forge must connect to the structure on at least 2 sides. Then, right click the forge block with an empty hand to craft the armor.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest432.name
questDatabase.description: Diamonds and emeralds are limited in their ability to store LP. With this sword, you are able to get the crystallized souls from your enemies. Time to go hunting.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest433.name
questDatabase.description: Time for some rituals. The most basic one you'll probably get first is the ritual of binding.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest434.name
questDatabase.description: Mining never was easier. Just right-click with this tool and all the stone is gone! Like all bound tools, this uses a massive amount of LP.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest435.name
questDatabase.description: Ever wanted to clear out a large terrain with dirt, gravel and sand? Why not let demons do it? This shovel, imbued with the soul of a demon will unleash the power on your will. But be warned: The demon you're about to summon with this is thirsty, and it costs a lot of LP to make use of it, so make sure your LP pool is full!

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest436.name
questDatabase.description: Upon right click while activated, this axe will clear out any wood within a large area. Be warned: This uses a huge amount of LP. You might suffer from sudden death...

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest437.name
questDatabase.description: Bloodmagic is fine, so is Thaumcraft. Why not combine both worlds?

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest438.name
questDatabase.description: Unlike the simple spells with foci and paradigm, the complex spell system is incredible... complex. There are way too much combinations to cover them here, so it's advised to look for the knowledge in other places. However, with the items from this quest, you are able to craft a simple mining spell.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest439.name
questDatabase.description: Three steam backpacks give a better one = Tier 2.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest440.name
questDatabase.description: Oak trees which give apples?  Who the hell added this to Minecraft? You find a way of combining an oak sapling and an apple to get an apple tree sapling. Try to plant one to get a permanent source of food.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest441.name
questDatabase.description: Three basic lootbags give a better one = Steam.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest442.name
questDatabase.description: Eating raw potatoes isn't that healthy, as you might have noticed. Some Potatoes are green and poisonous already. After you get a Furnace you can make delicious baked potatoes as another food alternative. Put a baked potato on a stick to make it even more delicious.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest443.name
questDatabase.description: Three Tier 2 backpacks give a better one = Tier 3.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest444.name
questDatabase.description: You now have some melon slices or pumpkins but what can you do with them? Well just eat them or... use a mallet to get some seeds... OK, let's craft one. Perhaps you can use this mallet for some other things too.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest445.name
questDatabase.description: Three Tier 3 backpacks give a better one = Tier 4

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest446.name
questDatabase.description: With a sword in one hand, what can you do with the other? Right, you need a shield. Let's get one.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest447.name
questDatabase.description: Three Tier 4 backpacks give a better one = Tier 5.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest448.name
questDatabase.description: Your wooden shield is very weak. So you look for a better one. Looks like you need leather, so go and find some cows.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest449.name
questDatabase.description: Three Tier 5 backpacks give a better one = Tier 6.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest450.name
questDatabase.description: Since you can't make any vanilla bow before LV and Tinkers weapons are not in this Tier you find a way to make a spear out of sticks, leather and a string. Get one because some infernal monsters are easier to kill with a long range weapon.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest451.name
questDatabase.description: Triggered by having a "Lamp of Cinders" in your inventory.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest452.name
questDatabase.description: Triggered by making a singularity.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest453.name
questDatabase.description: Triggered by making a "Shard of Creation".

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest454.name
questDatabase.description: Triggered by making a "Life Shard" and a "Soul Shard".

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest455.name
questDatabase.description: Triggered by finding a "Mysterious Crystal".

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest456.name
questDatabase.description: Triggers the Life Canister Quest after a Wither death.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest457.name
questDatabase.description: Triggers if you have been on Pluto.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest458.name
questDatabase.description: Triggered by the Primordial Pearl.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest459.name
questDatabase.description: Triggers if you craft the Primordial Focus.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest460.name
questDatabase.description: Triggers after you craft a Vortex.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest461.name
questDatabase.description: Triggers if you arrived at The End.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest462.name
questDatabase.description: Triggers if you craft the Catalyst.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest463.name
questDatabase.description: Speed rune is the only Tier 2 rune. The speed rune does what its name implies, provides an additive 20% increase to the processing speed of the Blood Altar.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest464.name
questDatabase.description: I will ask the technician about this stuff, but I need to reach a good reputation first. He is a busy man, and I don't want to be denied.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest465.name
questDatabase.description: Triggers if you get Neutronium Ore.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest466.name
questDatabase.description: Triggers if you find Black Plutonium.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest467.name
questDatabase.description: Triggers if you have a Void Capsule.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest468.name
questDatabase.description: Triggers if you get Thaumite Nuggets.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest469.name
questDatabase.description: Are you now waiting for the carrots to grow? Go and find some berry bushes and berries. The berries are a good source of food and you can put these bushes around your house to make a wall. It should provide a good protection against all those monsters that want to come into your house and kill you.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest470.name
questDatabase.description: Hmmm... what can you do with all those berries? Just eating? You will see that they have a very low saturation Level. Let's plant the new berry bushes and mix the berries to make some better food.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest471.name
questDatabase.description: Maybe you noticed already that eating the same food too often is very boring and not healthy any more. Some food like tea leaf can be taken to the furnace and processed further. So take a break and drink a cup of tea. Maybe munch some tasty raisins as they are very good also.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest472.name
questDatabase.description: When your Tinkers tables are ready you can craft your first tool. If you did not find a village yet you can only craft flint tools. Let's start with a pickaxe, an axe and a shovel. At this point swords are unobtainable since they need metals like iron or bronze which you will get at a later stage. In the meantime use your GregTech swords. Your new tools are weak at first but the more you use them the better they will get. They will level up to level 99 if you play long enough. Tool parts can be replaced for a bit of level XP, however the tool must be fully repaired first.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest473.name
questDatabase.description: Now it's time to make your first Tinkers sword. First you have to make blade, hand guard and tool rod cast forms. Melt some bronze in the smeltery and cast your tool parts. Tadaa... there is your first TC Sword.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest474.name
questDatabase.description: Find iron, copper and tin ore. Very funny... How can you mine these with just a flint pickaxe? I have an idea; bring me all the stone you mined with your flint pickaxe and I will give you a better tool head in exchange.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest475.name
questDatabase.description: To process more advanced materials like HSS-E, HSS-S, naquadah or draconium you need more than 4500K. Upgrade your EBF to 5400k.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest476.name
questDatabase.description: To process more advanced materials like naquadah-alloy you need more than 5400K. Upgrade your EBF to 7200k.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest477.name
questDatabase.description: To process the most advanced materials like neutronium, fluxed-electrum or awakened draconium you need more than 7200K. Upgrade your EBF to 9001k. (OVER 9000!!!)

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest478.name
questDatabase.description: After you make steel you are able to craft flint and steel. I guess you want to travel to the Nether as soon as possible but be aware; the Nether is a very dangerous place.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest479.name
questDatabase.description: Now more dangerous with Extra Hardcore Infernal Mobs. Have fun and take care.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest480.name
questDatabase.description: Another copper source  is "Malachite" which can be found between Y level 10 and 40. This vein contains more iron ore variants like "Brown Limonite", "Yellow Limonite" and "Banded Iron Ore".

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest481.name
questDatabase.description:
I guess you already processed a bit of wood into charcoal and wonder what you can do with all this creosote oil?
Well you can burn it in the normal furnace to cook your food or you can make more torches with it. Later in the LV age you probably should run Diesel Generators with it.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest482.name
questDatabase.description: Trying to get some leather or wool? You probably need to spend a lot of time hunting animals and traveling around, or you coul simply make a farm to get a decent amount of leather, wool and meat.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest483.name
questDatabase.description: If you are wondering: Why do I never get seeds when destroying Grass? You are right. Try to work with your new mattock on the grass blocks that do not have water anywhere nearby to find some seeds.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest484.name
questDatabase.description:
Tired of waiting since your carrots grow sooooo slow... ?
Well I got an idea, bone meal will help you grow food in seconds. Ok, chop down some trees and I will give you some bone meal.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest485.name
questDatabase.description: It's time to feed your new coke oven with some wood to get more charcoal. You are looking for the most efficient way to plant trees. Try to find some spruce saplings and some jungle saplings. Both can be planted in a 2x2 grid to get bigger trees.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest486.name
questDatabase.description: You have found a way to make leather more durable and more resistant by further processing it. Make some bound leather from four pieces of leather, some stings and a woven cotton. Now you only have to hang it on a drying rack and wait about 10 minutes to get some tanned leather.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest487.name
questDatabase.description: As you might know: tanned leather is more resistant and good enough for a backpack. Let's get a digger's backpack and a miner's backpack. Each pack holds different items. So use both for your first true back-packed mining experience.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest488.name
questDatabase.description: There are many more backpacks: Hunter, Builder, Forester...

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest489.name
questDatabase.description: Your lunch bag is now so abused and rather old so it's time to get something better. Let's craft a lunch box which can hold way more food.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest490.name
questDatabase.description: Are you ready for a small trip? With your new lunch box, saddle, lead and of course a horse we can start a small journey.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest491.name
questDatabase.description: Carrying the bed with you all the time the looks very funny. Why don't you craft a sleeping bag to stay outside without placing a bed and changing your spawn point. Be warned: If you play on a server then you'd better sleep below Y level 128, as nights are very cold in the mountains...

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest492.name
questDatabase.description: Killing sheep to get the wool is so ineffective. Making some shears would make sense if you need more wool.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest493.name
questDatabase.description: Small gears require a wire cutter to be made, so let's craft one.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest494.name
questDatabase.description: If you didnt't find any Redstone veins, it is quite important to look for one now. Try your luck at Y level 5-40.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest495.name
questDatabase.description: To make your first macerator you need two diamonds, and to enter the Twilight Forest you need one. Finding a diamond vein would help you a lot. Go and find some at Y level 5-20.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest496.name
questDatabase.description: Making rubber is now more complicated, you need raw rubber and sulfur. Finding a sulfur vein in the Nether seems like a good idea, doesn't it? Found on Y level 5-20.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest497.name
questDatabase.description:
You have found an alternative way of making charcoal with a "Charcoal Pile Igniter". 
Go and start getting massive amounts of charcoal.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest498.name
questDatabase.description:
Exploring some dungeons or fighting mobs probably gave you a lot of XP. Better use it to get iron, copper, tin or other useful dusts before you die during the next fight.
Place your tank on the ground and a drain on top. Now you can fill it with XP.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest499.name
questDatabase.description: You have almost made it. One last crafting step is required in order to advance to Tier 2. Keep going!

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest500.name
questDatabase.description: As usual. In order to get started with bees, you need a few basic things. Most important... a scoop.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest501.name
questDatabase.description: The next thing to do: Find bee hives around the world. There are 11 mundane bees that can be found, of which 8 are located in the Overworld. Any kind of bee will work for this quest.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest502.name
questDatabase.description: Now that you've destroyed the poor bees homes, you should build them a new one.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest503.name
questDatabase.description: Every bee has multiple properties that define what the bee does, how it behaves in rain or at night, and a couple of other aspects. It is mandatory to keep track of those properties.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest504.name
questDatabase.description: In order to get into bee breeding, you need a way to see all the traits, active and inactive. You only want to breed so called "pure" bees; For those, both "Active" and "Inactive" traits are identical.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest505.name
questDatabase.description: The best you can get, for all your scanning and analysing needs.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest506.name
questDatabase.description:
In order to continue with bees, to mutate and breed them as you like, you need mutagen. This greenish, smelly liquid needs to be refined from bacterial sludge, that seems to be available only on Mars. You will be able to continue, once you've arrived there.

In the meantime you can start working with the Genetics mod, since we all know Gendustry is too easy... Check out the recipes and you will understand why you should look into the Genetics mod.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest507.name
questDatabase.description: The bee house can be used to stabilize mutations, for example if you have successfully bred two different bees, but the passive traits are different from the active ones. Still to actually breed those together, you need something different.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest508.name
questDatabase.description: Mutations can be boring, they can be annoying, and most times, they are frustrating. With this machine, you will get a 100% pure bred mutation. If the combination of princess and drone can result in multiple mutations, the outcome is random. But who cares?

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest509.name
questDatabase.description: With this machine, you can extract a random trait from any bee, sapling, butterfly or flower. The bee/sapling/butterfly/flower will be destroyed in this process. Each process requires an empty gene sample and labware.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest510.name
questDatabase.description: Also known as labware. Be prepared. In order to do serious bee-work, you need stacks of diamonds. I'm not joking, stacks!

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest511.name
questDatabase.description: With this powerful machine, you can inject gene samples, which allows you to alter any aspect of your bee/tree or butterfly. The gene sample (or pattern) will not be destroyed. The success rate is 100%, and one labware is consumed per injection.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest512.name
questDatabase.description: DNA samples of species and/or traits are pretty valuable. You always should keep at least one of each effect/trait/species you get your hand on in a chest somewhere safe. By using this machine, you are able to copy any DNA sample, for the cost of an empty serum vial and some labware.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest513.name
questDatabase.description: A more advanced version of the mutatron. It uses more energy to mutate a drone with a princess, but the mutation is a 100% success, and you can select which mutation you want to have. This machine is a must-have for high-tier bees.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest514.name
questDatabase.description:
To get the various traits from a bee, you need a lot of power, labware and an empty gene sample. You don't need a lot of those, as you can just throw them in a furnace to remove remaining DNA of traits you don't need or want. 

In the meantime you can start working with the Genetics mod, since we all know Gendustry is too easy... Check out the recipes and you will understand why you should look into the Genetics mod.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest515.name
questDatabase.description: Templates are used to combine multiple gene samples into one large batch. It can be used to apply multiple traits at once, but you can also replicate a bee from liquid DNA and protein, if you manage to fill all 13 traits in one template. These templates can also be copied, just like the small samples.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest516.name
questDatabase.description: You probably will end up with a lot of excess drones while doing bees. (Or saplings if you do trees). Instead of throwing them away, you could also turn them into... Something useful.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest517.name
questDatabase.description: They say, breakfast is the most important meal of the day. This machine turns raw meat into liquid protein, which is used to create bees from scratch.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest518.name
questDatabase.description: Out of princesses to inject traits to? Too lazy to find hives and get more bees? Not a problem. With this nifty little device, you can use a ton of power, liquid DNA and protein to create any bee you wish to have. The only drawback is: All bees will be ignoble, which means they will die after a random amount of cycles.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest519.name
questDatabase.description: On your way to awesome bees, you have to collect only the best traits available.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest520.name
questDatabase.description: On your way to awesome bees, you have to collect only the best traits available.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest521.name
questDatabase.description: On your way to awesome bees, you have to collect only the best traits available.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest522.name
questDatabase.description: On your way to awesome bees, you have to collect only the best traits available.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest523.name
questDatabase.description: On your way to awesome bees, you have to collect only the best traits available.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest524.name
questDatabase.description: On your way to awesome bees, you have to collect only the best traits available.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest525.name
questDatabase.description: On your way to awesome bees, you have to collect only the best traits available.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest526.name
questDatabase.description: On your way to awesome bees, you have to collect only the best traits available.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest527.name
questDatabase.description: On your way to awesome bees, you have to collect only the best traits available.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest528.name
questDatabase.description: On your way to awesome bees, you have to collect only the best traits available.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest529.name
questDatabase.description: The fifth item you'll need a lot of. For the Microwave, the Scanner, the Precision Laser Engraver, etc.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest530.name
questDatabase.description: The sixth item you'll need a lot of. For the Scanner and the Seismic Prospector.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest531.name
questDatabase.description: Automate your bee or crop scanning. Later on, this machine gets very useful for scanning high tier machine parts for the assembly line research data or to fill data orbs with data for the UU Matter production.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest532.name
questDatabase.description: You probably collected a ton of creosote and maybe even have built your first 'Eclectic' Blast Furnace. Creosote will be a good fuel for the moment. So try to build a few of the Diesel Generators and use them besides steam as a secondary power source.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest533.name
questDatabase.description: Some centrifugal processes leave gases behind like hydrogen or methane. Centrifuge some brown and yellow Limonite to get hydrogen or dump your unused food in a Centrifuge to get methane gas.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest534.name
questDatabase.description: If you are running your Bronze Blast Furnace for a long time you will sometimes get headaches, nausea and other weird effects. Yes this is pollution... from making so much steel. If you can collect some rubber sheets, you can get a hazmat suit for free.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest535.name
questDatabase.description: Are you wondering how to process redstone without any Macerator? Well you can mine it with a GregTech hammer and get the crushed ore. Then use with the hammer in the crafting table to get some impure redstone dust. After this, fill a cauldron with water and drop some dust in. You will get pure redstone dust for your red alloy ingots.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest536.name
questDatabase.description: Low tier wires like red alloy and tin can be made in a crafting table. Copper wire requires an Alloy Smelter. So let's make a mold for the rubber plates.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest537.name
questDatabase.description: Witches are always infernal and very dangerous. Be careful since they throw potions at you.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest538.name
questDatabase.description: Macerating ores usually doubles the output. If you want MOOOOOOORE, craft an ore washer and wash out some rare materials.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest539.name
questDatabase.description: After purification of your ore dust, you can centrifuge it to get even more byproducts out of the dust.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest540.name
questDatabase.description: Combining cobalt brass and diamond dust makes a really sharp saw blade for your Cutting Machine.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest541.name
questDatabase.description:
If you want to cut diamond blocks into plates it's time to get a new alloy 'Cobalt Brass'.
First you need to make brass out of zinc (found only in small ores or as centrifuge byproduct from tin or tetrahedrite) and copper. Mix it with aluminum and cobalt dust (can be centrifuged from various materials) to get your new alloy.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest542.name
questDatabase.description: Using the power of water and electricity you can get even more out of your dust.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest543.name
questDatabase.description: Want to make some nitro-diesel, plastic or some chemical dye? Then it's time to craft a Chemical Reactor.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest544.name
questDatabase.description:
It is a compressor but that doesn't mean it is compact... 
It is highly recommended to get one of these electric compressors, as the efficiency in terms of coal/steam used to compress something is a lot better when using EU.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest545.name
questDatabase.description:
I hope you are not thinking about what I am thinking you are thinking about... 
It is highly recommended to get one of these, as the efficiency in terms of coal/steam used to extracting something is a lot better when using EU.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest546.name
questDatabase.description:
During your travels you may have seen some of these huge oil wells. Now it's time to go make a pump and put this black gold into tanks. Oil can be burned in the Diesel Generator or refined. 

Bring a Diesel Generator with you to power the pump. (Thanks to the advancement of technology the pipe machine can auto output on top.)

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest547.name
questDatabase.description: Burning oil in the Diesel Generator is a very ineffective way of getting power. Every bucket/cell of oil only gives you 20,000 EU. Try refining it...

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest548.name
questDatabase.description: First step is to distill your oil into light sulfuric fuel with a burn value of 40,000 EU.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest549.name
questDatabase.description:
By adding hydrogen to sulfuric light fuel in a Chemical Reactor you can produce some light fuel with a very high burn value of 320,000 EU.

The remaining hydrogen sulfide cells can be used later to produce some sulfuric acid for your TNT/iTNT or acid batteries.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest550.name
questDatabase.description: Centrifuge some brown or yellow limonite dust to get some hydrogen.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest551.name
questDatabase.description: Second step is to distill your oil into heavy sulfuric fuel with a burn value of 40,000 EU.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest552.name
questDatabase.description:
By adding hydrogen to sulfuric heavy fuel in a Chemical Reactor you can produce some heavy fuel with a burn value of 240,000 EU.

The remaining hydrogen sulfide cells can be used later to produce some sulfuric acid for your TNT/iTNT or acid batteries.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest553.name
questDatabase.description:
Mixing your light and heavy Fuel together gives you some diesel.
It burns very well in the Diesel Generator with a burn value of 400,000 EU.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest554.name
questDatabase.description: The mixer is a very useful device. You can mix all kind of fluid and items. (Useful to prevent dust from falling on ground when crafting.)

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest555.name
questDatabase.description: You can get some nitrogen by centrifuging... air. This process takes a long time, especially at the LV Tier.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest556.name
questDatabase.description:
Kids, today we will make some glyceryl trinitrate with some nitrogen, carbon dust and water.
    - Chemistry 101

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest557.name
questDatabase.description: 720,000 EU per cell. Yes, yes, this is very good! Make some nitro-diesel and power your MV Diesel Engine with it. For LV Diesel Engines this fuel is too potent!

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest558.name
questDatabase.description: After you make your first steel you're able to craft the small backpack. In this bag you can put a lot of the stuff you want to carry around. With 36 slots it is a bit bigger than a small chest.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest559.name
questDatabase.description: The low pressure boiler tank is the easiest way to store steam. The firebox needs this tank on top to produce steam. The bigger the boiler the slower it heats up, but it will make more steam when heated up.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest560.name
questDatabase.description:
As an alternative way to steam you can use the Railcraft boilers. They require at least one firebox.
More than one size is possible: (1x1 mentioned above) 2x2 and 3x3. Each Boiler needs 1, 2 or 3 layers of tanks on top, depending on size.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest561.name
questDatabase.description:
Cresosote oil into steam! After you make your first steel you are able to craft a liquid fueled firebox.
Diesel, ethanol, creosote and biofuel all work well here.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest562.name
questDatabase.description: After you make steel you are able to craft a high pressure boiler tank. The upgraded version increases the temperature and produces more steam than the low pressure version.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest563.name
questDatabase.description: The bookshelf can only be made with an Assembling Machine. Maybe someone thinks this is crazy...

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest564.name
questDatabase.description: Three basic foresters lootbags give a better one = Advanced Foresters Lootbag.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest565.name
questDatabase.description: Three advanced foresters lootbags give a better one = Expert Foresters Lootbag.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest566.name
questDatabase.description: Three space invaders Moon lootbags give a better one = Space Invaders Mars Lootbag.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest567.name
questDatabase.description: Three space invaders Mars lootbags give a better one = Space Invaders Asteroids Lootbag.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest568.name
questDatabase.description: Three novice lootbags give a better one = Adept Lootbag.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest569.name
questDatabase.description: Three adept lootbags give a better one = Master Lootbag.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest570.name
questDatabase.description: Three master lootbags give a better one = Grandmaster Lootbag.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest571.name
questDatabase.description: Sixteen grandmaster lootbags give a better one = Grandmaster Unique Lootbag.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest572.name
questDatabase.description: Three BM novice lootbags give a better one = BM Adept Lootbag.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest573.name
questDatabase.description: Three BM adept lootbags give a better one = BM Master Lootbag.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest574.name
questDatabase.description: Three basic bee lootbags give a better one = Advanced Bee Lootbag.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest575.name
questDatabase.description: Three advanced bee lootbags give a better one = Expert Bee Lootbag.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest576.name
questDatabase.description:
A manual crafting table which remembers the last nine used recipes. Left click one of the recipes shown in the right-hand side to automatically fill in the crafting grid. Right-click to lock a memorized recipe and prevent a newer recipe from bumping it off.

Resources need to go into the internal inventory. The crafting matrix is only a visual representation.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest577.name
questDatabase.description: This sturdy casing is the basis for almost all machines in Forestry, essentially being the forestry equivalent of a Machine Casing.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest578.name
questDatabase.description:
The Carpenter is similar to an Automatic Crafting Table. It has an item input slot and a storage slot for the recipes. Some recipes need an additional fluid like water, creosote, honey or molten redstone. With the Carpenter you can make farmblocks, woven backpacks, bee and tree analysers and many more.

The Carpenter needs power to work. You can use a GT cable or a battery box to connect to the machine or make some Forestry, Railcraft or Buildcraft RF Engines.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest579.name
questDatabase.description:
You heard that the Carpenter needs some molten redstone for a few recipes. 
Converting redstone dust into a fluid requires a Fluid Extractor. Let's build one.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest580.name
questDatabase.description: The Thermionic Fabricator is used to craft electron tubes and stained glass. It requires redstone flux (RF) energy to run. It is your first machine which is made in the Carpenter. Once warmed up, it needs to maintain a certain heat level to operate. The amount of power supplied will determine how much heat will be generated. If you do not supply enough power to maintain the current temperature it will slowly drop.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest581.name
questDatabase.description:
Before you can craft your first farm block you need apatite tubes. Make some apatite long rods first (Using a Lathe or Extruder). You need golden bolts and a red alloy plate.
Put glass into your Thermionic Fabricator and make your first tubes.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest582.name
questDatabase.description: The smallest farm you can build requires 36 farm blocks. For water input you need a valve, items go through the hatches and to supply the farm with energy you need a gearbox. With the farm control block you can control which fields of your farm work by applying a redstone signal. Remember to put creosote in the Carpenter when crafting the farm blocks.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest583.name
questDatabase.description: This chip is optional and more advanced. The farms are working without them too. If you want to configure your farm you need one of them.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest584.name
questDatabase.description:
The (Forestry) soldering iron is a tool used for attaching electron tubes to circuit boards in order to manipulate how an electrical engine works or to program Multifarms. As well as upgrading the Squeezer or Centrifuge.
Once electron tubes have been attached to a circuit board they cannot be removed, only replaced. The circuit board is automatically crafted as soon as the basic recipe requirements are met, so it's best practice to first place your electron tubes and then add the circuit board.

The soldering iron can also be used to remove the circuit board from Electrical Engines, MultiFarms, Squeezers and Centrifuges by opening the machine's GUI and left clicking the soldering iron on the circuit board slot.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest585.name
questDatabase.description: Your Thermionic Fabricator needs heating coils to function. So combine some magnetized (requires Polarizer) steel rods with some copper wire and make some.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest586.name
questDatabase.description: Want to make some automated farms or work with bee and tree breeding? Then this is the right chapter for you.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest587.name
questDatabase.description: Magnetic steel rods need a polariser to craft. Make a few for your coils in the next step.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest588.name
questDatabase.description: It is now time to search for some ores. Apatite is the most basic material in Forestry. You can make fertilizer, farm blocks and many other things. The vein is found between Y level 40-60.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest589.name
questDatabase.description:
Farm hatch (Pipe connectivity)

You can supply and extract items from the farm by using farm hatches that are connected to pipe systems. 

Supplying items
The farm hatch is clever enough to know which item goes where. If an item isn't appropriate for the farm's configuration, the hatch will simply reject it.

Extracting items
Any item that is harvested by the Multifarm is automatically ejected by the farm hatches into inventories or pipes. Pipes can be used to extract from other sides.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest590.name
questDatabase.description:
Farm valve (Hydration)

Some farms require water for hydration purposes. Although you can do it manually by supplying it through liquid containers (such as cans), you can also automate the process by using farm valves.

By connecting fluid pipes into the farm valve and supplying water, you can automatically fill the farm's water tank.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest591.name
questDatabase.description:
Farm control

You can control which fields of your farm work by applying a redstone signal to the control block. You can either shut down the whole farm by applying a redstone signal from top or below or you can disable a specific side by applying a redstone signal on the matching side of the control block.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest592.name
questDatabase.description:
Farm gearbox (Power)
To power your farm and have it automatically harvest crops, you will need at least one farm gearbox.

Farm operations can be hastened with additional gearboxes.

Each farm gearbox requires power. You can use RF or EU.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest593.name
questDatabase.description: This chip is optional and more advanced than the basic one. The farms can work without them too. If you want to configure your farm you need one of them.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest594.name
questDatabase.description: This chip is optional and more advanced than the enhanced one. The farms are working without them too. If you want to configure your farm even more you need one of them.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest595.name
questDatabase.description: This chip is optional and more advanced than the refined one. The farms are working without them too. If you want to configure your farm even more you need one of them.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest596.name
questDatabase.description: It's upgrade time. Unlock redstone and obsidian level for your tools.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest597.name
questDatabase.description:
Maybe you are wondering why you need tetrahedrite or stibnite. Well, antimony can be centrifuged out of it which is very useful for batteries in the LV Age.
This vein can be found between Y level 80-120.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest598.name
questDatabase.description: The most efficient way to get antimony for batteries is to centrifuge stibnite dust, the second most efficient way is to use tetrahedrite dust.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest599.name
questDatabase.description: A optional machine to get different byproducts out of your crushed and purified ore dust. This machine becomes very useful when you have reactors and want to recycle your depleted fuel rods.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest600.name
questDatabase.description: The hunger is constantly following you, consuming you, never letting you rest. The world around you is full of nourishing fruits and vegetables. Use them to curb your insatiable hunger.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest601.name
questDatabase.description: Placing blocks by hand can be tedious. Wouldn't it be nice to be able to place blocks like "Another 9 here"? Well, good news. Get yourself some of the various building blocks, and I shall reward you.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest602.name
questDatabase.description: You detected a weird disturbance in the air around an enderman, I suggest you try to steal some of their pearls and research them.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest603.name
questDatabase.description: You've heard rumors, that the Endermen had build Laboratories in the End. To invent new machines and weapons in order to attack the Overworld. One of their inventions is a chest, which is somehow linked to all instances of itself. Go and try to find one of those.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest604.name
questDatabase.description: Your investigation into the pearls has shown you that the source of the disturbance seems to be coming out of the shimmering portals inside Strongholds. You feel strangely drawn into its depths.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest605.name
questDatabase.description: Find and kill Ender-Eyes, guarding the Defence Towers

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest606.name
questDatabase.description: Well if you decided to grind then do it... Kill some of the guardians.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest607.name
questDatabase.description: If you're bored, you can resurrect the Dragon. Or, you could find a ChaosDragon, if you dare. Anyway, kill one of those, and you'll be rewarded.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest608.name
questDatabase.description: Next step of making batteries is to collect some lead. Lead and galena veins can be found in the Twilight Forest.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest609.name
questDatabase.description:
Mixing antimony and lead in the Alloy Smelter gives some battery alloy.
Combine it with some tin cable and voila there is your small battery hull.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest610.name
questDatabase.description: You can't find lead, galena or silver in the Overworld or the Nether. So it's time to explore the Twilight Forest a bit and find this vein at Y level 5 - 40.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest611.name
questDatabase.description:
Mercury and acid batteries are single-use batteries. They are crafted fully charged but cannot be re-charged. Once their stored energy is depleted, they can be placed in an Extractor to be converted back into small battery hulls.

They can be placed in the battery slot of any standard LV GregTech machine, in which case they will be depleted before the machine's internal EU storage. They can also be used in battery buffers.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest612.name
questDatabase.description:
Mercury and acid Batteries are single-use batteries. They are crafted fully charged but cannot be re-charged. Once their stored energy is depleted, they can be placed in an Extractor to be converted back into small battery hulls.

They can be placed in the battery slot in any standard LV GregTech machine, they will be depleted before the machine's internal EU storage. They can also be used in battery buffers.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest613.name
questDatabase.description: Sodium, cadmium, and lithium batteries are rechargeable batteries. They are crafted without stored energy, but can be charged in any GregTech machine. If unneeded, they can be placed in an Extractor and converted back into small battery hulls, but their contents are lost.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest614.name
questDatabase.description: Sodium, cadmium, and cithium batteries are rechargeable batteries. They are crafted without stored energy, but can be charged in any GregTech machine. If unneeded, they can be placed in an Extractor and converted back into small battery hulls, but their contents are lost.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest615.name
questDatabase.description: Sodium, cadmium, and lithium batteries are rechargeable batteries. They are crafted without stored energy, but can be charged in any GregTech machine. If unneeded, they can be placed in an Extractor and converted back into small battery hulls, but their contents are lost.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest616.name
questDatabase.description: Mercury can be centrifuged out of redstone. If you find some cinnabar ore in the redstone vein you can use that too.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest617.name
questDatabase.description:
The Fluid Canner is a fundamental machine, since it is necessary to move fluids around, as well as for filling tin cells, glass bottles, buckets, and even batteries.

Another interesting thing about the Fluid Canner is that it can be transformed into a raintank, by attaching a drain cover on its top (Any machine with tank actually can be...).

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest618.name
questDatabase.description: Combining hydrogen sulfide and water in the Chemical Reactor gives sulfuric acid for your single use acid batteries. If you made some light and heavy fuel already maybe you have some spare hydrogen sulfide. If not, you can make sulfuric acid with some sulfur and water in the Chemical Reactor too.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest619.name
questDatabase.description: Batteries can be placed directly in machines. To recharge a battery you need a battery buffer. They come in different sizes: 1, 4, 9 and 16 slots.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest620.name
questDatabase.description: Some recipes require IC2 batteries. Fill your battery hull with some molten redstone and you get your small battery.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest621.name
questDatabase.description: A second source for sodium is glauconite ore or glauconite sand. This vein can be found at Y level 20-50.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest622.name
questDatabase.description:
Salt ore mixes can be found in the Overworld between Y level 50-70. Salt isn't only used to get sodium, it's an important ingredient in many Pam's Harvestcraft food recipes.

Lepidolite and spodumene are good sources of lithium for your batteries.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest623.name
questDatabase.description: The best way to get rare earth is to find an AE2 meteorite and grind the blocks into dust. Maybe you completed the quest in the steam age and stored your crushed skystone somewhere? That dust can now be centrifuged into various byproducts like cadmium, neodymium, caesium, lanthanum, and yttrium.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest624.name
questDatabase.description: The Canning Machine is mainly used to fill tin cans with any kind of food, but it is useful for filling and emptying tin cells with other solid items than food, usually in the form of dust. It can also fill batteries with redstone, cadmium, lithium or sodium.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest625.name
questDatabase.description:
Packing your chests and barrels without spilling all the things (Buildcraft (TM))? 
No problem! Make a dolly and you can carry your full chests and barrels anywhere you want. Be warned you will get a slowness debuff so hopefully you don't have to travel far.

Hint : Place the dolly holding your chest/barrel in a bag of some sort to avoid the slowness.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest626.name
questDatabase.description: Do you want to move the spawners around and build some cool mob farms? No problem with the Diamond Dolly.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest627.name
questDatabase.description: Crafting some grain bait for your Animal Trap.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest628.name
questDatabase.description: Crafting some fruit bait for your Animal Trap.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest629.name
questDatabase.description: Crafting some veggie bait for your Animal Trap.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest630.name
questDatabase.description: Crafting some fish bait for your Fish Trap.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest631.name
questDatabase.description: Tired of hunting for cows, zombies or sheep? You can build a trap and hope some animal or monster drops will be caught inside.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest632.name
questDatabase.description: Have you ever tried to catch a fish with your bare hands? It's time to craft a fishing rod and get some fish the easy way. Cast your fishing rod in some water and wait until the bobber dips into the water. Then reel back in your line and hopefully you caught a fish.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest633.name
questDatabase.description: Fishing can be very boring. Why not to automate it with a fish trap?

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest634.name
questDatabase.description: It's time to plant some wheat to make some bread or to prepare grain bait for your animal traps.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest635.name
questDatabase.description:
The first step in making bread is to macerate your wheat into flour with a mortar or a Macerator.

Flour can be used in many food recipes for Pam's Harvestcraft food.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest636.name
questDatabase.description:
Baking your dough in a Furnace makes some tasty bread.
Your first bread!

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest637.name
questDatabase.description:
Water and flour makes a dough or two...
Dough can be used in many food recipes from Pam's Harvestcraft.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest638.name
questDatabase.description: Smelt your bread again and you get some toast!? Give's you more nutrition points, and unlocks more culinary potential!

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest639.name
questDatabase.description: Another distillate you can make out of oil is sulfuric naphtha with a burn value of 40,000 EU in the Gas Turbine.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest640.name
questDatabase.description: Centrifuging your refinery gas gives you LPG with a burn value of 320,000 EU, the same as naphtha. Also it is a way to get methane and eventually epichlorohydrin.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest641.name
questDatabase.description:
You can process sulfuric naphtha to fluid naphtha which has a burn value of 320,000 EU in the Gas Turbine.
Naphtha is also a base product for polyethylene and polycaprolactam.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest642.name
questDatabase.description: Another distillate for your Gas Turbine you can make out of oil is sulfuric gas with a burn value of 25,000 EU.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest643.name
questDatabase.description: Refine your gas in a Chemical Reactor to give it a better burn value of 160,000 EU, and maybe use it to make methane.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest644.name
questDatabase.description: First step is to distill your oil into light sulfuric fuel with a burn value of 40,000 EU.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest645.name
questDatabase.description: If for some reason you want to be able to jump down a cliff without getting the message "Player X fell from a high place". Great idea would be to find a way to soften your landing first. The hang glider should do just fine.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest646.name
questDatabase.description:
The electrotine battery is exclusively used in project red machines and the jetpack.
Electrotine is a mixture of redstone and electrum dust.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest647.name
questDatabase.description:
Your glider gets you to the ground safely but it does not have any method to get up. After you researched electrotine you discovered that it is powerful enough for your first jetpack.
A diamond chestplate surrounded with 4 electrotine batteries is powerful enough to bring you up in the air.

It does not have a hover mode so you better take your glider with you.  This jetpack can't fly higher than Y level 128.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest648.name
questDatabase.description:
GREAT.... you now have an empty jetpack.
You need 25 electrotine dust to completely fill it.
Let's craft an Electrotine Generator and a Charging Bench to use the power of electrotine. 
You will very quickly discover that, while it is fast and cheap, it's empty in the blink of an eye. Despite this, it is useful in combination with the hang glider to get into the air and to get away from hairy situations.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest649.name
questDatabase.description:
Your coal jetpack needs coal and water to produce steam. After a short warm-up period you can go and take it for a ride. Keep in mind you will need your glider to make a soft landing.

Put your jetpack on your back and hit Shift and the adventure backpacks action-key to start it.

Max flying height for jetpacks is limited to Y level 185.

Vertical velocity decreases linearly with height after overcoming optimal height - 135 for jetpack and 100 for copter.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest650.name
questDatabase.description:
The copter jetpack is the first jetpack with a hover mode. It is using all kind of different fuel types in buckets. 
Buckets of creosote, lava, oil and fuel will work.
Equip your jetpack and hit Shift and the adventure backpacks action-key. You can also switch between hover and normal mode.

Max flying height is limited to Y level 200. 

Vertical velocity decreases linearly with height after overcoming optimal height - 135 for jetpack and 100 for copter.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest651.name
questDatabase.description:
Your first electrical jtpack. You need to hit the IC2 mode-switch key to toggle between normal mode and hover mode.

The only limitation is that you can't fligh higher than Y level 185.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest652.name
questDatabase.description:
This jetpack uses IC2 biogas and can fly up to Y level 245.
You can switch between hover and normal mode using the IC2 mode-switch key.

Your jetpack can be (re-)fueled in the IC2 Fluid Canner with 30 buckets/cells worth of biogas.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest653.name
questDatabase.description:
The advanced electric jetpack is an upgraded version of the electric jetpack.
While worn in the chest armor slot and charged with EU, it allows the player to fly. It provides no armor protection, but will charge tools being used in the same manner as the advanced lappack from its 3,000,000 EU internal storage.

The advanced electric jetpack is limited to a maximum flying height of Y level 256.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest654.name
questDatabase.description: Combining the advanced electric jetpack and nanosuit yields you the advanced nano chestplate. Now you have the protection of the chestplate combined with the freedom of movement of the jetpack.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest655.name
questDatabase.description: The gravi chestplate is the ultimate quantum armor combined with a high powered jetpack. It also has hidden features that you need to discover while wearing the whole quantum armor.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest656.name
questDatabase.description: You have been using your hide shield long enough. After you make your first tools, grab a bit of iron ore and make a better iron shield.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest657.name
questDatabase.description:
Upgrade your wooden spear with a stone arrowhead and iron screws to a stone spear.
This spear has better durability.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest658.name
questDatabase.description:
Upgrade your wooden spear with an iron arrowhead and two steel screws to an iron spear. 
The iron spear has better durability than the stone variant.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest659.name
questDatabase.description:
At MV Tier you can upgrade your iron spear to a diamond one. Get a diamond arrowhead, two stainless steel screws and a wooden spear.
This spear has superior durability.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest660.name
questDatabase.description: Your iron shield got very old. With a shield made from diamond plates you can maintain block up to 5 seconds.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest661.name
questDatabase.description:
Wow, your first handmade *ehm* machine made bow. You find out that you can put the bow in the Mine and Blade Battlegears slots. Now it's time to make a quiver and maybe some arrows. You can put up to 4 stacks of arrows in your quiver.

Let's go hunt a bit.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest662.name
questDatabase.description: The Arc Furnace is an alternative to smelting stuff back into components and making wrought iron. The recipes use oxygen and 3 amperes of power.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest663.name
questDatabase.description: A faster alternative to steel production is to use the Arc Furnace and smelt the iron ingots into wrought iron ingots. Then macerate them to dust and smelt them very fast in the EBF to steel. (Some might even dare arc furnacing the dust itself...)

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest664.name
questDatabase.description:
Upgrade your battery buffer to hold 4 batteries which allows max 4 ampere output.
Useful for your EBF and the Arc Furnace.

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest665.name
questDatabase.description:
To cook some healthy food you need a few tools crafted first.
Saucepan, 
pot, 
rolling pin, 
mortar, 
mixing bowl, 
soft mallet, 
skillet, 
knife...

questDatabase.name: gtnh.quest666.name
